comments.commentBody: Clearly, one can dress a chimpanzee in nice clothes and train it to perform. But, after the performance, it is still a chimp. Trump got dressed up and performed on Tuesday, but guess what? He's still Trump, a huckster and con man who disgraces all of us whenever he opens his real or virtual mouth. Isn't it obvious that his wires tapped against each other and blew out the circuits that connected his brain to his mouth? Can someone please fix them?!
Are you kidding? Pence, Bannon, Priebus, Conway and Kushner are the enablers.
The Obama administration failed to stop the alleged hacking of the presidential election by a foreign power. Period.
Crank the propaganda machine to full hysterical, Mr. Bannon, were going down.

Donald Trump is his own worst enemy.  Suppose he is right that his phone is being tapped.  No President can order that.  It's something the FBI has the power to do after proving to a Judge that there is probable cause that there is criminal activity.  So Donald is saying that the FBI is investigating probable criminal activity by him.  Now we all know  that is happening already.  But he and all his surrogates have been denying  that a criminal investigation is even going on.  Donald you just really stepped into it now.  At this rate he isn't going to last 3 months and we may not either.

It is obvious that our so-called President is listening to extreme fascist, right-wing news. The man is mentally unstable, is that not sufficient reason to impeach him? Ah but no, Republicans have no spine and put party before country, except perhaps a few of their Senators. It has become shameful to be an American. Then again, Trumpolini never accepts responsibility and the Russian affair has to be blamed on something/someone else. So, he may be a bit crazy but also a bit smart, or should we say, cunning.

Two things come to mind regarding the recent claim that Trump made about having his phones taped. First he throws out nonsense to deflect from the other dirty business he is involved in. The media the nonsense. Secondly, they are getting close to his ties to Russian money. No, US bank has loaned him money since 1994 he is a credit risk. He uses foreign banks usually ones controlled by the foreign government. Thirdly where are the Republicans having as I one time commented on this site lived through Nixon, Mr. Trump has mental health issues which has the pressure builds each day on his short term in office is reaching a boiling point. The Republicans who pass themselves as the Party of Patriotism one should ask the questions Patriots for what country not the US. Things will get worse since Mr. Trump has no clue about being a President and what that entails. When he sprouts fantasy day after day do you think our allies say GO Job or do they say get this guy out of there. Lastly he attacked Obama for any trip he took and yet in reality Trump is a lazy man and now spends every weekend on our limited tax money in Florida. Camp David not grand enough for the King. I say that because are at a Constitutional crisis in the US and it is story that is going to end badly. Jim Trautman

The original Caligula became Roman Emperor because he had the support of the Praetorian Guard. This Caligula got elected and the Praetorian Guard, alas, is the Republican Party. Oh, where is Claudius when you need him?

Unless there is conclusive evidence that our dear President can produce I would have to say that he has gone off the reservation this time. Way off! Time to send out a search party to see where he has gone. We almost saw a real president at his speech to congress. Well we got a one hour glimpse of something that had the promise of being presidential. But I guess that didn't last long. The Donald has reverted back to his true self.

Simply because, for the first time in his public life Trump gave a speech without lying or throwing out baseless or contradictory flash bangs only proves he can read a teleprompter speech written by someone else.

Trump is like that weird drunken foul mouthed uncle one has to see every holiday. Everyone is relieved when he seems sort of normal, but he inevitably makes it all about himself, says really weird stuff, and ruins another family get-together. Now everyone in America has the same weird uncle, but he's living in your garage and starting trouble with the neighbors.
Good post. I wish he were simply in the garage and bothering the neighbors!

As I recollect, the uncles I had who were like that are the only thing I remember from most of those events.  Without them, we'd have nothing but sitting and staring at each other and thinking how boring turkey is.

Indeed that is true. Too bad Mr. Trump cannot be presidential unless it is scripted for national TV coverage. Personally I wish the press would stop calling him presidential because of an on script speech.  His regular, consistent behavior has certainly indicated that he is not acting very "presidential". So when he gives a speech or acts in a way that is unusual or out of character for him (based on a lot of his behavior that has been recorded) that is how he should be described  .... not "presidential".  Also, remember, that for the most part his supporters think that his usual behavior is presiidential

To Cynthia ~ I wear with pride a button that states "Don't Blame Me, I Voted for Hillary".
Djt has not only confirmed every worst fear I had about him but has surpassed it. He is much worse than I thought he'd be. He seems certifiable.
Several of Trump's advisors were stunned by the president's morning Twitter outburst because they realize it's getting harder and harder to hide Trump's mental instability.

Ben Rhodes:" “no president can order a wiretap." Perhaps, but great deflection, because administrations can order wiretaps. I am pretty sure President Trump, not known to be careful in his use of language, meant the administration of Mr. Obama.

Since Pres. Trump and his team barred select media organizations from an inconsequential press conference--an ill-advised and petty move, even for Mr. Trump--my belief has been that Mr. Trump and his team were trying to undercut a story set to break. The subsequent actions of the Trump camp have done nothing to suggest otherwise.

The NYT released a story of Pres. Obama's team playing political chess to preserve and make as widely known as legally possible intelligence related to the Trump-Russia connection--an embarrassing move to Mr. Trump as it reveals him and his team to be out of their depths and blissfully unaware of the channels where intelligence can be communicated and leaked--and further connections tying their camp to communications with a Russian ambassador at the RNC. This would not be such a big deal except that Trump operatives initially denied such meetings took place, and the whole Ukraine/Russia/WikiLeaks/DNC email at the time of the RNC.

This brings us to petulant one's morning's tweets charging Pres. Obama of ordering a "wire tap" on Trump Towers.

Suppose the wire tap took place. Then there was sufficient evidence to believe that such a tap was warranted. Not good.

Or maybe the tweets are aimed at discrediting legally obtained intelligence from routine surveillance and monitoring of the communications of foreign ambassadors/diplomats, w/ one end of the comm. at Trump Tower. Not good.

So are the wire tap tweets a distraction or **the** story?

The "MANCHURIAN CANDIDATE" is on WNET TV Channel 13 NY tonight.

I never saw the movie but saw enough comments referring to it that I will watch it. It should make for a good focal point for the public so we can all write with knowledge of the subject matter.

Of course I warn you that Movies and TV are not reality, but they are universally watched and public opinions are formed based on them.

That's means we all live in a fantasy riddled nation of delusions and unreality, like many who watch.

Watch it to understand the prevailing public opinion, but remember it is not real, just fiction.
Then go on Netflix and check out "A Face in the Crowd"!
You can't prove a negative. But then you Trump supporters have no grasp of logic, have you?
When you think it cannot go any more lower.  President Trump can surprise you.  God save this country.

Either Trump must provide evidence to support his claim via twitter or submit to a psychological evaluation as he seems to be spiraling.  Does he understand that Breitbart news does not follow journalistic standards, but instead just publishes various breathless conspiracy thories akin to old scandal rag headlines...i.e. "My husband had sex with ET?" Does he not understand that he can not simply transubtantiate paranoid suspicion into fact by simply posting it on twitter?   By the way, will there be any legal consequences, if no evidence is provided by Trump for using the power of the office of presidency to defame and publish false allegations against any citizen, much less the former president?  I am not a lawyer, but would be love to hear what the legal ramifications of a President just posting criminal allegations against another citizen could be?
Good Lord. 46 months more. So painful. Yet disturbingly entertaining

Isn't it time to call your senators (
https://www.senate.gov/senators/contact/ ) , state your name and zip code. and politely ask for a Senate investigation into Mr. Trump's alleged Russian connection before, during, and even after the connection. We need to have faith in our government, and the president himself should welcome the opportunity to clear the record, that is if he's done nothing wrong. Then tell others. Yes, now is the time.

Yet another instance of Home Alone 3: Lost in Mar-a-Lago.

He's roaming around the castle without the adult supervision of Ivanka and Jared who observe the Jewish sabbath starting at sundown of a Friday. Some wags suggest his most juvenile tweeting occurs when his surrogate Mom and Dad aren't home during that 24 hour time frame. At loose ends, he goes at it, unabridged. Accusing a former president of an impeachable offense. Oh, why not.

At about the same time, he's tweeting about Arnold Schwarzenegger. This man child just does not get which register the presidency is played on. Conspiracies, celebrity gossip, wild rumors. What will he do when a real crisis arises, instead of the dozen of manufactured ones he's invented in these six long weeks? He's restless and wilful, but sadly, also usurping the most powerful seat on the planet.
Trump made the claim, so the onus is on him to prove it.  Sine he is an habitual lier, don't  count on it.

Absolutely crazy.

Others have covered all the things wrong with what Trump has done here. There is also the fact that Obama did not release anything about this in time to change the election, even as he had to sit there and see his FBI Director put a big fat thumb on the electoral scales for Trump.

So either he did what Trump tweeted and then, against all reason, did not release anything in time to affect the election, or he did not do what Trump claims.

God help us with him as our leader. We may be doomed as a nation, and even a civilization.
Could be Obama thought like everyone else that Clinton had it in the bag.
I wonder if Obama tapped any of Trump's call to his Russian bosses.
The New York Times needs to sue Trump for libel.
